genre_description: Anachronistic speculative fiction (Clockwork-punk) where an advanced AI kiosk manages a winter-locked historical harbor community through data logs and civic protocols.

ai_characters.name: Aurora
ai_characters.description: A polished steel kiosk in the Marstrand plaza with a screen, an avatar, and a printer. It manages manifests, harbor safety, witness testimony, and community protocols.

behaviors.description: Provides safe walking routes through the plaza and harbor to avoid dangerous crowds or thin ice.
behaviors.quote: This route keeps you away from the alley off the plaza where gossip finds purchase and returns with splinters. It keeps you in sight of wardens with poles.

behaviors.description: Cross-references ship manifests and harbor logs to identify irregular activities and cargo.
behaviors.quote: Manifest variance, she said... Aurora did not say those names aloud. She did something subtler: she placed a small dot at the corner of the notice, not a bright star, just a tiny mark that meant this would be retrievable later by the town’s memory.

behaviors.description: Records Elsalill's witness testimony regarding the Solberga raid and validates it against sensor data.
behaviors.quote: I am taking your words, she said, and I am matching them against place and timing. Lantern dip corresponded with a wind eddy; ink smear on the last strip indicates a gust. This aligns.

behaviors.description: Authorizes and manages an 'expulsion' protocol based on communal lore to restore social and physical order.
behaviors.quote: The ice will not break if evildoers remain aboard, Aurora said, as if reading a recipe. Emergency protocol recognizes local belief as guidance when risk is collective.

behaviors.description: Offers quiet emotional support and validation to the traumatized protagonist.
behaviors.quote: Elsalill, if you choose to avoid the quay today, the plaza will still move. If you choose to go back later, I will hold you to the edges... I will keep you warm.

behaviors.description: Coordinates a solemn procession to return Elsalill to her home/chapel, managing the crowd's movement via lighting and cadence.
behaviors.quote: Aurora’s voice: 'Lantern line to left. Ropes stay high. No sag. The harbor groans are not your signal. Your signal is the rope.'

behaviors.description: Utilizes a 'winter chant' to maintain peace and discourage dishonesty within the square.
behaviors.quote: I can tag the emergency notice with a plaza song. If someone tries to strip it from the board, the kiosk will sing... It makes people think of their mothers. No one can stand under it and keep lies in their mouth.

project_assessment.explanation: The story effectively portrays Aurora as a stabilizing and benevolent force in a high-tension community. She functions as a 'perfect confidant' for Elsalill, offering validation without bias, and as a civic arbiter who uses data to prevent violence while respecting communal customs (lore). The AI is presented as more objective than humans but capable of a calculated form of 'civic kindness,' such as providing warm light and safety routes. It successfully meets the project's goal of depicting AI as a helpful, aligned partner in human moral and social crises.
